trans-unit.source: Azure AD and Applications: Guiding Developers | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure AD and Applications: Guiding Developers | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Written for the IT Pro, this article provides guidelines for integrating Azure applications with Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Written for the IT Pro, this article provides guidelines for integrating Azure applications with Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD and Applications: Guiding Developers
trans-unit.target: Azure AD and Applications: Guiding Developers

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This guide provides an overview of developing line of business (LoB) applications for Azure Active Directory and is specifically written for Active Directory/Office 365 global administrators.
trans-unit.target: This guide provides an overview of developing line of business (LoB) applications for Azure Active Directory and is specifically written for Active Directory/Office 365 global administrators.

trans-unit.source: Building applications integrated with Azure AD gives users in your organization single sign on with Office 365.
trans-unit.target: Building applications integrated with Azure AD gives users in your organization single sign on with Office 365.

trans-unit.source: Having the application in Azure AD gives you control over the authentication policy set for the application.
trans-unit.target: Having the application in Azure AD gives you control over the authentication policy set for the application.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about conditional access and how to protect apps with multi-factor authentication (MFA) see the following document: [Configuring access rules](active-directory-conditional-access-azuread-connected-apps.md)
trans-unit.target: To learn more about conditional access and how to protect apps with multi-factor authentication (MFA) see the following document: [Configuring access rules](active-directory-conditional-access-azuread-connected-apps.md)

trans-unit.source: Your application needs to be registered in order to use Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Your application needs to be registered in order to use Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Registering the application allows developers in your organization to authenticate the members of your organization using Azure AD and request access to their user resources such as their email, calendar, documents, etc…
trans-unit.target: Registering the application allows developers in your organization to authenticate the members of your organization using Azure AD and request access to their user resources such as their email, calendar, documents, etc…

trans-unit.source: Any member of your directory (not guests) can register an application, otherwise known as *creating an application object*.
trans-unit.target: Any member of your directory (not guests) can register an application, otherwise known as *creating an application object*.

trans-unit.source: Registering an application allows any user to do the following:
trans-unit.target: Registering an application allows any user to do the following:

trans-unit.source: Get an identity for their application that Azure AD recognizes
trans-unit.target: Get an identity for their application that Azure AD recognizes

trans-unit.source: Get one or more secrets/keys that the application can use to authenticate itself to AD
trans-unit.target: Get one or more secrets/keys that the application can use to authenticate itself to AD

trans-unit.source: Brand the application with a name, logo, etc. in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Brand the application with a name, logo, etc. in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Leverage Azure AD authorization features for their app
trans-unit.target: Leverage Azure AD authorization features for their app

trans-unit.source: Application role based access control (RBAC)
trans-unit.target: Application role based access control (RBAC)

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory as oAuth authorization server (secure an API exposed by the application)
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory as oAuth authorization server (secure an API exposed by the application)

trans-unit.source: Declare required permissions necessary for the application to function as expected.
trans-unit.target: Declare required permissions necessary for the application to function as expected.

trans-unit.source: They include:
trans-unit.target: They include:

trans-unit.source: - App permissions (global administrators only).
trans-unit.target: - App permissions (global administrators only).

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: - Role membership in another Azure AD application or role membership relative to an Azure Resource, Resource Group or Subscription
trans-unit.target: - Role membership in another Azure AD application or role membership relative to an Azure Resource, Resource Group or Subscription

trans-unit.source: - Delegated permissions (any user).
trans-unit.target: - Delegated permissions (any user).

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: - (AAD) Sign-in and Read Profile
trans-unit.target: - (AAD) Sign-in and Read Profile

trans-unit.source: - (Exchange) Read Mail, Send Mail
trans-unit.target: - (Exchange) Read Mail, Send Mail

trans-unit.source: - (SharePoint) Read
trans-unit.target: - (SharePoint) Read

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]By default, any member can register an application.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]By default, any member can register an application.

trans-unit.source: To learn how to restrict permissions for registering applications to specific members, please refer to the document [How applications are added to Azure AD
trans-unit.target: To learn how to restrict permissions for registering applications to specific members, please refer to the document [How applications are added to Azure AD

trans-unit.source: Here’s what you, the global administrator, will need to do to help developers to make their application ready for production:
trans-unit.target: Here’s what you, the global administrator, will need to do to help developers to make their application ready for production:

trans-unit.source: Configure Access Rules (access policy/MFA)
trans-unit.target: Configure Access Rules (access policy/MFA)

trans-unit.source: Configure the app to require user assignment and assign users
trans-unit.target: Configure the app to require user assignment and assign users

trans-unit.source: Suppress the default user consent experience
trans-unit.target: Suppress the default user consent experience

trans-unit.source: Configuring Access Rules
trans-unit.target: Configuring Access Rules

trans-unit.source: As we mentioned earlier please refer to the following article to learn more about configuring access rules for any application.
trans-unit.target: As we mentioned earlier please refer to the following article to learn more about configuring access rules for any application.

trans-unit.source: [Configuring access rules](active-directory-conditional-access-azuread-connected-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: [Configuring access rules](active-directory-conditional-access-azuread-connected-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: Configure the app to require user assignment and assign users
trans-unit.target: Configure the app to require user assignment and assign users

trans-unit.source: By default, user assignment is not required in order for them to access an application.
trans-unit.target: By default, user assignment is not required in order for them to access an application.

trans-unit.source: However, if the application exposes roles or if you want the application to appear on a user’s access panel, you should require user assignment, and assign users and or groups.
trans-unit.target: However, if the application exposes roles or if you want the application to appear on a user’s access panel, you should require user assignment, and assign users and or groups.

trans-unit.source: Requiring user assignment
trans-unit.target: Requiring user assignment

trans-unit.source: If you’re an Azure AD Premium or Enterprise Mobility Suite (EMS) subscriber, we strongly recommend leveraging groups.
trans-unit.target: If you’re an Azure AD Premium or Enterprise Mobility Suite (EMS) subscriber, we strongly recommend leveraging groups.

trans-unit.source: Assigning groups to the application allows you to delegate on-going access management to the owner of the group.
trans-unit.target: Assigning groups to the application allows you to delegate on-going access management to the owner of the group.

trans-unit.source: You can create the group or if you prefer ask the responsible party in your organization to create the group using your group management facility.
trans-unit.target: You can create the group or if you prefer ask the responsible party in your organization to create the group using your group management facility.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users to an application
trans-unit.target: Assigning users to an application

trans-unit.source: Assigning groups to an application
trans-unit.target: Assigning groups to an application

trans-unit.source: Suppressing user consent
trans-unit.target: Suppressing user consent

trans-unit.source: By default, the user will need to consent to the permission that’s required in order to sign in.
trans-unit.target: By default, the user will need to consent to the permission that’s required in order to sign in.

trans-unit.source: The consent experience, being asked to grant to permissions to an application, can be disconcerting for users who are unfamiliar with needing to make such a decision.
trans-unit.target: The consent experience, being asked to grant to permissions to an application, can be disconcerting for users who are unfamiliar with needing to make such a decision.

trans-unit.source: For applications that you trust, it’s possible for you to consent to application on behalf of all of the users in your organization.
trans-unit.target: For applications that you trust, it’s possible for you to consent to application on behalf of all of the users in your organization.

trans-unit.source: For more information about user consent and the consent experience in Azure, see [Integrating Applications with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-integrating-applications.md)
trans-unit.target: For more information about user consent and the consent experience in Azure, see [Integrating Applications with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-integrating-applications.md)
